+There are 2 types of (or purposes for) proxies required for the VO Frontend: 
+
+1. The %GREEN%VO Frontend proxy%ENDCOLOR% (used to authenticate with the other glideinWMS services) 
+2. One or more glideinWMS %RED%pilot proxies%ENDCOLOR% (used/delegated to the factory services and submitted on the glideinWMS pilot jobs).
+
+The %GREEN%VO Frontend proxy%ENDCOLOR% and the %RED%pilot proxy%ENDCOLOR% can be the same. By default, the VO Frontend will run as user `frontend` (UID is machine dependent) so these proxies must be owned by the user `frontend`.
+
+- [Automatic renewal without VOMS Admin](#automatic-renewal-without-voms-admin) **(Recommended)**
+- [Manual renewal](#manual-proxy-renewal)
+- [Example of automatic renewal](#example-of-automatic-proxy-renewal)
+
+### Automatic Renewal without VOMS Admin
+
+This section describes how to automatically renew your frontend and pilot proxies without a VOMS Admin server, which is now [deprecated](https://opensciencegrid.github.io/technology/policy/voms-admin-retire/) in the OSG. If your VO uses non-OSG VOMS Admin servers, consult [this section](#example-of-automatic-proxy-renewal) instead
+
+!!! note
+    You must have access to the certificate/key pair corresponding to your VO's entry in `/etc/vomses` of the `vo-client` package. If you do not have access to these credentials, contact your [VO manager](http://oim.opensciencegrid.org/oim/vo).
+
+#### Obtaining information from your current proxy
+
+The first step is to obtain information from your current proxy. Assuming the location of your current proxy is at `<PATH_TO_OLD_PROXY>`. Then run the following command to obtain information from your current proxy:
+
+    :::console
+    root@host # voms-proxy-info --file %RED%<PATH_TO_OLD_PROXY>%ENDCOLOR% -all
+    subject   : /DC=org/DC=opensciencegrid/O=Open Science Grid/OU=Services/CN=pilot/glidein2.chtc.wisc.edu/CN=287414457
+    issuer    : /DC=org/DC=opensciencegrid/O=Open Science Grid/OU=Services/CN=pilot/glidein2.chtc.wisc.edu
+    identity  : /DC=org/DC=opensciencegrid/O=Open Science Grid/OU=Services/CN=pilot/glidein2.chtc.wisc.edu
+    type      : RFC compliant proxy
+    strength  : 1024 bits
+    path      : credential_chtc2.main_745540
+    timeleft  : 5441:28:37
+    key usage : Digital Signature, Key Encipherment, Data Encipherment
+    === VO GLOW extension information ===
+    VO        : GLOW
+    subject   : /DC=org/DC=opensciencegrid/O=Open Science Grid/OU=Services/CN=pilot/glidein2.chtc.wisc.edu
+    issuer    : /DC=org/DC=opensciencegrid/O=Open Science Grid/OU=Services/CN=glow-voms.cs.wisc.edu
+    %BLUE%attribute : /GLOW/Role=htpc/Capability=NULL %ENDCOLOR%
+    timeleft  : 71:34:02
+    %BLUE%uri       : glow-voms.cs.wisc.edu:15001 %ENDCOLOR%
+
+The most important fields to take notice are `attribute`, `VO` and `uri`. Write them down since they would be needed in the next steps
+
+#### Generating a proxy using voms-proxy-fake
+
+!!! warning
+    To create a proxy using `voms-proxy-fake` that works the proxy must be signed by the same certificate as the non-fake proxy. In practice this means you need to have access to the certificate and key of your voms admin server (i.e the certificate and key of the `issuer` mention in this [section](#obtaining-information-from-your-current-proxy)).
+
+In order to create a proxy using `voms-proxy-fake`, run:
+
+    :::console
+    root@host # voms-proxy-fake  -debug            \
+    -cert %RED%<PATH_YOUR_PILOT.CERT>%ENDCOLOR%    \
+    -key %RED%<PATH_YOUR_PILOT.KEY>%ENDCOLOR%      \
+    -out %RED%<PATH_TO_NEW_PROXY.PROXY>%ENDCOLOR%  \
+    -fqan /GLOW/Role=htpc/Capability=NULL          \
+    -voms GLOW                                     \
+    -hours 24                                      \
+    -hostcert /etc/grid-security/voms/vomscert.pem \
+    -hostkey /etc/grid-security/voms/vomskey.pem   \
+    -uri glow-voms.cs.wisc.edu:15001
+
+!!! note
+    The `fqan` has to match the `attribute` of [section](#obtaining-information-from-your-current-proxy).
+
+!!! note
+    The `voms` attribute has to match the `VO` attribute `VOMS` and same for uri.
+
+Once this is done running a `voms-proxy-info` in `<PATH_TO_NEW_PROXY.PROXY>` should yield something like this:
+
+    :::console
+    root@host # voms-proxy-info --file %RED%<PATH_TO_NEW_PROXY.PROXY>%ENDCOLOR% -all
+    subject   : /DC=org/DC=opensciencegrid/O=Open Science Grid/OU=Services/CN=pilot/glidein2.chtc.wisc.edu/CN=proxy
+    issuer    : /DC=org/DC=opensciencegrid/O=Open Science Grid/OU=Services/CN=pilot/glidein2.chtc.wisc.edu
+    identity  : /DC=org/DC=opensciencegrid/O=Open Science Grid/OU=Services/CN=pilot/glidein2.chtc.wisc.edu
+    type      : proxy
+    strength  : 1024 bits
+    path      : %RED%PATH_TO_NEW_PROXY.PROXY%ENDCOLOR%
+    timeleft  : 23:30:51
+    key usage : Digital Signature, Key Encipherment, Data Encipherment
+    === VO GLOW extension information ===
+    VO        : GLOW
+    subject   : /DC=org/DC=opensciencegrid/O=Open Science Grid/OU=Services/CN=pilot/glidein2.chtc.wisc.edu
+    issuer    : /DC=org/DC=opensciencegrid/O=Open Science Grid/OU=Services/CN=glow-voms.cs.wisc.edu
+    attribute : /GLOW/Role=htpc/Capability=NULL
+    timeleft  : 23:30:51
+    uri       : glow-voms.cs.wisc.edu:15001
+
+#### Creting a script fro automatic proxy renewal
+
+This section describes how to create a script to automaticly renew proxies using `voms-proxy-fake`. More information on how to generate a proxy using `voms-proxy-fake` can be found in [section](#generating-a-proxy-using-voms-proxy-fake).
+
+1. Create a script that looks like to generate proxies called `/etc/cron.hourly/renew_proxies.sh`
+
+        :::file
+        #!/bin/sh                                                                                                                          
+        # renew frontend proxy                                                                                                             
+        grid-proxy-init  -debug                      \
+         -cert %GREEN%<VO_FRONTEND_CERT>%ENDCOLOR%   \
+         -key  %GREEN%<VO_FRONTEND_KEY> %ENDCOLOR%   \
+         -out %GREEN%<VO_FRONTEND_PROXY>%ENDCOLOR%   \
+         -hours 24
+        chown frontend:frontend	%GREEN%<VO_FRONTEND_PROXY>%ENDCOLOR%
+
+        # renew pilot proxy                                                     
+        voms-proxy-fake  -debug                         \
+         -cert %RED%<PILOT_CERT>%ENDCOLOR%              \
+         -key %RED%<PILOT_KEY>%ENDCOLOR%                \
+         -out %RED%<PILOT_PROXY>%ENDCOLOR%              \
+         -fqan /GLOW/Role=htpc/Capability=NULL          \
+         -voms GLOW                                     \
+         -hours 24                                      \
+         -hostcert /etc/grid-security/voms/vomscert.pem \
+         -hostkey /etc/grid-security/voms/vomskey.pem   \
+         -uri glow-voms.cs.wisc.edu:15001
+        chown frontend:frontend %RED%<PILOT_PROXY>%ENDCOLOR%
+        
+
+2. Make the script executable
+
+        :::console
+        root@host # chmod +x /etc/cron.hourly/renew_proxies.sh
+
+3. Test the script
+
+        :::console
+        root@host # run-parts /etc/cron.hourly
+
+4. Make sure the script ran correctly and that `%RED%<PILOT_PROXY>%ENDCOLOR%` and `%GREEN%<VO_FRONTEND_PROXY>%ENDCOLOR%` were generated:
+
+        :::console
+        root@host # voms-proxy-info --all --file %RED%<PILOT_PROXY>%ENDCOLOR%
+        root@host # voms-proxy-info --all --file %GREEN%<VO_FRONTEND_PROXY>%GREEN%
+
+5. Once you tested the script works you can replace the `-debug` options with `-q` (quiet).
